solution_line_template: First find the area of one side of a roof: {roof_side_length_ft_1} feet * {roof_side_length_ft_2} feet = <<{roof_side_length_ft_1}*{roof_side_length_ft_2}={area_one_side_sq_ft}>>{area_one_side_sq_ft} square feet

Then multiply that number by {num_slanted_sides_per_roof} to find the total area of both sides of the roof: {area_one_side_sq_ft} square feet/side * {num_slanted_sides_per_roof} sides = {area_both_sides_per_roof_sq_ft} square feet

Then multiply that number by the number of roofs to find the total area of all the roofs: {area_both_sides_per_roof_sq_ft} square feet/roof * {num_roofs} roofs = {total_area_all_roofs_sq_ft} square feet

Then multiply the total area of the roofs by the number of shingles needed per square foot to find the total number of shingles needed: {total_area_all_roofs_sq_ft} square feet * {shingles_per_sq_ft} singles/square foot = <<{total_area_all_roofs_sq_ft}*{shingles_per_sq_ft}={total_shingles_needed}>>{total_shingles_needed} shingles
